sect1.title: Identification, username and password
sect1.para: Whenever you launch PMB you will be presented with a screen whch asks for a username and password.
This username and password were given to you by your administrator. If you are the library IT administrator who installed PMB, consult Users and rights section of the PMB Administrator's Guide.
By default, if no user accounts have been created, connect with username admin ; and password admin.
You can see at the top left two tabs: Management and OPAC. If you click on OPAC, the OPAC will be displayed.
Once connected, the PMB user licence (cecil licence) is displayed.

sect1.title: Change your password
sect1.para: The user preferences are accessible at any time from the link edit your account, which can be found at the top right of the screen (note: the user sets up here the "librarian" who has access to the PMB management interface). For more information see .
You can edit your password from the user preferences, or ask your PMB administrator to change it for you. For more information on user administration options, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.
